title: Salt Marsh, Kazakhstan
description: The Caspian Sea (not pictured) is the largest inland body of water by surface area. With an average depth of about 5 m, the northern part of the Caspian is very shallow, while the central and southern parts of the sea are much deeper. The salinity of the waters also change from north to south, being more saline in the northern, shallow waters and less in the south.
